bibl.title: The Border Troops of the Roman-Byzantine Southern Egyptian Limes: Problems and Remarks on the Role of the African and 'Black' African Military Units.
bibl.note: Examines the composition of the Roman-Byzantine border troops of the Egyptian-Nubian limes with special reference to the role of African and 'black' African units or individual soldiers as stratiotai, limitanei, foederati, symmachoi, bucellarioi and nautai. Their role during the Muslim Arab conquest of Egypt is assessed with special reference to Copts, Beja and Nubians.
